Newsletter RSS Mobile Facebook Twitter Beaches | Best of OC | Blogs | Columns | Comics | Contests | Food | Gift of Giving | Health and Fitness | Home and Garden | Horoscopes | OC Moms | OC People | Outdoors | Pets | Photos | Puzzles and Games | Shopping and Deals | Video «Previous Post Next Post» All Posts Fast food’s most unhealthy french fries
February 25th, 2010, 3:27 am· ·posted by Nancy Luna, Staff Writer
Five Guys cuts and blanches its Russet potatoes before frying them in peanut oil.
We all know that french fries aren’t the best thing for you on any restaurant menu.
But how unhealthy are they? Men’s Health magazine recently reported its findings in America’s Worst French Fries report. And, boy, am I devastated by one of the chains that made the list: Five Guys Burgers&Fries .
The fries at Five Guys are oh-so-good. But, alas, the fresh-cut potatoes, fried in peanut oil, were named the Worst Regular Order of Fries.
The nutritional breakdown of a large order: 1,464 calories, 71 g fat (14 g saturated) and 213 mg sodium.
Five Guys is set to open its first Orange County unit in Orange later this year. I asked local franchisee Phil Ratner, who operates two other Five Guys in Cerritos and Carson, what he thought about the‘worst’ranking. He said most customers split a large.
“We tell our customers that a large fry feeds 3 to 4 people depending on appetite and a regular feeds 2-3,”he said.”Our regular customers have all of this figured out after a couple of visits.”
To my surprise, McDonald’s fries were dubbed the“best”fries to eat if you insist on eating French fries. Here’s why: a small order contains 230 calories, 11 g fat (1.5 g saturated) and 160 mg sodium.
Other chains that made the list:
Worst Fries for Your Blood Pressure
Dairy Queen Chili Cheese Fries
“There’s as much sodium in this side dish as you’ll find in 15 strips of bacon,”the report stated.
Worst Wedge Fries Jack in the Box Bacon Cheddar Wedges
McDonald's fries
Worst Curly Fries Arby’s Curly Fries
To read the full report, including nutritional data on all categories, CLICK HERE .
Tell us: Do reports like this make you stop and think about what you’re eating? Or will you gobble your favorite french fries anyway?
More pics: Five Guys fries. Click on any image to enlarge.
Most customers share a large order, Five Guys franchisee Phil Ratner said.
Related stories: Posted in: Burger Joints • Fast food news • Healthy fast food • McDonald's • Nutrition • Five Guys • Five Guys Burgers&Fries • food surveys • French fries

Register Food Writers
Paul Hodgins is The Register’s wine columnist. He pens the Booze on a Budget column focusing on beer, wine and Happy Hour news every Tuesday and Friday on the Fast Food Maven blog. Marla Fisher is our Deals Diva blogger . She writes often about restaurant and grocery deals. The Food Frenzy blog gives readers daily reviews on local hidden gems in Orange County.
